author: sky.cactus
content: I think my position is currently that we should try to avoid *ever* having to fork both layers simultaneously.  We should always be designing changes that touch both such that they can be applied to one first, then the other.

author: sky.cactus
content: I *suspect* that will be possible in all cases, and it is generally a good practice when maintaining service oriented systems anyway.

author: ajsutton
content: I'd generally agree with that, but it depends on the specifics of the change. If decoupling the release significantly increases complexity or delivers a worse result then it may be better to just couple the releases.  Those cases should be rare, but good engineering almost always boils down to "it depends" and making the best choice based on the specific situation rather than blindly following rules.
